channel.title: Client error while trying to run
channel.description:
Go from one problem to another...
Everytime i try to run any client besides 1 or 2 i get this... [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/2q07vqg.jpg[/img]

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:19, topic:385201”]Then your compiler isn’t compiling every folder. Use this:

@ECHO OFF TITLE Building Files... ECHO Building files... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\*.java src\server\model\players\randomevents\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\range\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\melee\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\magic\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\minigames\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java TITLE Build Complete! ECHO Build complete! PAUSE [/quote]

How do you know he is using a highly packaged server?

Read full topic

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Then your compiler isn’t compiling every folder. Use this:

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Building Files...
ECHO Building files...
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\*.java src\server\model\players\randomevents\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\range\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\melee\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\magic\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\minigames\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java
TITLE Build Complete!
ECHO Build complete!
PAUSE

Read full topic
item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @hdmodzz hdmodzz
item.description:
@hdmodzz wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:17, topic:385201”][quote author=hdmodzz link=topic=480961.msg3521866#msg3521866 date=1299455887]

Ah so then your path for Java must of been changed or something on your other account. Sure I’ll have alook at your server, just PM me once you are up and running and if you need anymore help just let me know and I’ll have a look for you.

How does it fail? With the compiler make sure you have your JDK version declared in the run.bat. What does it say?

That compiler message above, like the other person said is nothing. Everyone has this. Unless you turn it off by using -Xlint:none or something…

Like i changed the welcome message, the tele spot, and then clicked compile it gave me that and i went on it and the updates didnt take affect :
[/quote]
You must click on your run.bat and reload it because it still has the old settings loaded.[/quote]

Ok so i go into config… i changed the starting message… i exit out the cmd box (the run one)
i click compile it gives me that i run it again i go on it and the affects arent there :\

Read full topic
item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“hdmodzz, post:15, topic:385201”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=480961.msg3521858#msg3521858 date=1299455564]
Ah so then your path for Java must of been changed or something on your other account. Sure I’ll have alook at your server, just PM me once you are up and running and if you need anymore help just let me know and I’ll have a look for you.

How does it fail? With the compiler make sure you have your JDK version declared in the run.bat. What does it say?

That compiler message above, like the other person said is nothing. Everyone has this. Unless you turn it off by using -Xlint:none or something…
[/quote]

Like i changed the welcome message, the tele spot, and then clicked compile it gave me that and i went on it and the updates didnt take affect :[/quote]
You must click on your run.bat and reload it because it still has the old settings loaded.

Read full topic
item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“hdmodzz, post:15, topic:385201”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=480961.msg3521858#msg3521858 date=1299455564]
Ah so then your path for Java must of been changed or something on your other account. Sure I’ll have alook at your server, just PM me once you are up and running and if you need anymore help just let me know and I’ll have a look for you.

How does it fail? With the compiler make sure you have your JDK version declared in the run.bat. What does it say?

That compiler message above, like the other person said is nothing. Everyone has this. Unless you turn it off by using -Xlint:none or something…
[/quote]

Like i changed the welcome message, the tele spot, and then clicked compile it gave me that and i went on it and the updates didnt take affect :[/quote]

That text in compiler cmd screen is nothing bad, just be sure to restart your server every time you compile the server so it can reload the .class files.

Read full topic

item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:10, topic:385201”]Try these three and tell me what happens. You’ve still not told me what you main class is though? Search for public void main in either client, EGUI or whatever else you have.

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
cd ./Class/
java  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

OR

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
java  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

OR

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
java  -Xmx512m client
pause

BUT REMEMBER!: CHANGE client to the exact name of the class that contains your main method AND what source is your client?

I have one more that I have beared in mind, bu I’ll wait and see what your source is first.[/quote]

The second one should work, but if it’s a non-renamed source the main class would be EGUI, but since he mentioned this only happens with Bluur’s client I would suspect that he is using a Bluur client.

[quote=“hdmodzz, post:11, topic:385201”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=480961.msg3521844#msg3521844 date=1299454214]
Try these three and tell me what happens. You’ve still not told me what you main class is though? Search for public void main in either client, EGUI or whatever else you have.

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
cd ./Class/
java  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

OR

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
java  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

OR

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
java  -Xmx512m client
pause

BUT REMEMBER!: CHANGE client to the exact name of the class that contains your main method AND what source is your client?

I have one more that I have beared in mind, bu I’ll wait and see what your source is first.
[/quote]

Alright, i made a different user on my comp went to that one and all the clients work so i guess problem solved, but do you know what it means when you compile something and ti says…

P.S. After i get all these many problems worked out and get my server up and running if you play it, you get auto admin :D[/quote]

That is just compiler messages, they’re not errors or anything bad.

Read full topic
item.source: Client error while trying to run

@hdmodzz wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:10, topic:385201”]Try these three and tell me what happens. You’ve still not told me what you main class is though? Search for public void main in either client, EGUI or whatever else you have.

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
cd ./Class/
java  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

OR

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
java  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

OR

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
java  -Xmx512m client
pause

BUT REMEMBER!: CHANGE client to the exact name of the class that contains your main method AND what source is your client?

I have one more that I have beared in mind, bu I’ll wait and see what your source is first.[/quote]

Alright, i made a different user on my comp went to that one and all the clients work so i guess problem solved, but do you know what it means when you compile something and ti says…

P.S. After i get all these many problems worked out and get my server up and running if you play it, you get auto admin

Try these three and tell me what happens. You’ve still not told me what you main class is though? Search for public void main in either client, EGUI or whatever else you have.

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
cd ./Class/
java  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
pause

OR

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
java  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32

OR

item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @hdmodzz hdmodzz
item.description:
@hdmodzz wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:6, topic:385201”]This is mine:

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
cd ./Class/
START javaw  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
EXIT

Adapt it to yours by changing the cd, if none then delete. And by changing client to the class that contains your main class. Until you search your files you wont know.

Also, you can change start javaw to just “java” and then this will display the command prompt.

You might not need the highmem 32 0 stuff either, depends on your client.[/quote]

Do you know why im having this problem? because im having it with every client actually… i think it might only be bluurd clients but even when i downloaded a servers client i get this.

Read full topic
item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

This is mine:

@ECHO OFF
TITLE Fear Factory
cd ./Class/
START javaw  -Xmx512m client 30 0 highmem members 32
EXIT

Adapt it to yours by changing the cd, if none then delete. And by changing client to the class that contains your main class. Until you search your files you wont know.

Also, you can change start javaw to just “java” and then this will display the command prompt.

You might not need the highmem 32 0 stuff either, depends on your client.

Read full topic
item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @hdmodzz hdmodzz
item.description:
@hdmodzz wrote:

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m JFrame 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

Thats it…

Read full topic
item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“hdmodzz, post:3, topic:385201”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=480961.msg3521638#msg3521638 date=1299442428]
JFrame is not your main class. Try editing the Run.bat and change the JFrame part to whatever class is your main. You’ll know this because it’ll have public void main (String args[]) {.
[/quote]

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

Thats what i have, ive never had this problem before either until now.[/quote]

@echo off
java -Xmx500m EGUI 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

or

@echo off
java -Xmx500m client 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

Read full topic
item.source: Client error while trying to run

item.title: Client error while trying to run
item.dc:creator: @hdmodzz hdmodzz
item.description:
@hdmodzz wrote:

Mendorphins:

JFrame is not your main class. Try editing the Run.bat and change the JFrame part to whatever class is your main. You’ll know this because it’ll have public void main (String args[]) {.

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

Thats what i have, ive never had this problem before either until now.

Read full topic
